info.title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud APIs
info.description: Salesforce Marketing Cloud APIs provide programmatic access to features such as Address, Assets (Content Builder), Audit, Contacts, Data Events, Event Notification, Interactions (Journey Builder), Push, SMS, Transactional Messaging, and Messaging. Refer to the official Salesforce documentation for detailed API usage and guidelines.

tags.description:
[https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_rn_2024_spring_as_single_use_de_import.htm&type=5](https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.mc_rn_2024_spring_as_single_use_de_import.htm&type=5)

# **Data Extension Imports**

You can use the Data Extension Import APIs to import data from various file transfer locations to a data extension, without creating an import definition.

You can import from pre-signed file sources such as, Amazon Web Service (AWS) and Microsoft Azure without configuring file transfer locations.

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Event Definitions
get.description: Retrieves a collection of event definitions.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter event definitions by name substring

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Event Definitions
post.description: Creates an event definition (name and data schema for an event) and defines an event definition key. The resource uses this key when firing an event to send it to the appropriate journey. Typically, marketers create the event definition in the Journey Builder UI. Use this resource instead if you are using a custom application for Journey Builder functionality.

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

parameters.name: eventDefinitionKey

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Journeys
get.description: Retrieves a collection of all journeys. The journey collection resources are embedded in the items property of the response body. Use both a sort order and paging to minimize the response size and response time.

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: The field and sort method to use to sort the results. You can sort on these fields: ModifiedDate, Name, Performance. You can sort these fields in ascending (ASC) or descending (DESC) order. The default value is modifiedDate DESC

parameters.name: definitionType
parameters.description: The type of definition to retrieve. The only accepted value is transactional, which retrieves all transactional send definitions

parameters.name: mostRecentVersionOnly
parameters.description: Use this parameter to specify whether to return the most recent version of each journey that matches the filter criteria. The default value is true

parameters.name: nameOrDescription
parameters.description: A search string to apply to the request. The API searches the name and description of each journey for this string, and returns all matching journeys

parameters.name: specificApiVersionNumber
parameters.description: The version number of the workflowApiVersion value to retrieve. The default value is 1

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A journey status value to use to filter the results. Possible values are: Deleted, Draft, Published, ScheduledToPublish, Stopped, Unpublished. The ScheduledToSend, Sent, and Stopped statuses exist only in single-send journeys. If you don't specify a status value, the API returns all journeys regardless of their statuses

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: A tag to use to filter the results. When you specify this parameter, the API returns only journeys with the specified tag

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: The version number of the journey to retrieve. The default value is the currently published version or the latest version number that meets the other search criteria

requestBody.description: Request body for updating an existing journey

304.description: No changes detected; request data matches server

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Journeys
post.description: Creates or saves a journey. To create a new journey provide the request body in the appropriate Journey Specification. Please read the Journey Spec page to understand which properties are required to create a journey via the API. The id, key, createdDate, modifiedDate, status and definitionId are assigned by Journey Builder and are never to be passed in as parameters for creating a journey.

requestBody.description: Request body for creating a new journey

post.summary: Get List Of Journeys Contact Is In
post.description: Provides a list of journeys and journey versions for a list of contact keys.

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

200.description: Successful response with contact list memberships

post.description: Removes up to 50 contacts from a journey or from one or more versions of a journey.

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

202.description: Accepted â€“ contact exit request successfully received

post.description: Returns the status of a request to remove a contact from a journey or from one or more versions of a journey.

200.description: Status of contact removal returned successfully

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Journeys
get.description: Retrieves a single journey by ID.

parameters.name: journeyId
parameters.description: ID of version 1 of the journey in the form of a GUID (UUID)

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version number of the journey to retrieve. If not provided, the latest version is returned

parameters.name: extras
parameters.description: A list of additional data to fetch. Available values are: all, activities, outcomes, and stats. Default is ''

parameters.name: journeyId
parameters.description: ID of the journey in the form of a GUID (UUID)

requestBody.description: Request body for updating an existing journey

304.description: No changes detected; request data matches server

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Journeys
delete.description: Deletes a journey by ID. When deleting last version of a journey, check if the journey is associated with a tag and unassociated the tag using the deleteTags resource.

parameters.name: journeyId
parameters.description: ID of the journey in the form of a GUID (UUID). The ID deletes all versions of the journey, unless a versionNumber is provided

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version number of the journey to delete. If no version is specified, ALL versions associated with the provided ID will be deleted

tags: Messaging & Journeys > REST > Interactions (Journey Builder) > Journeys

parameters.description: A list of additional data to fetch. Available values are: all, activities, outcomes, and stats. Default is ''

parameters.description: The key of the journey

delete.description: Deletes a journey by Key. When deleting last version of a journey, check if the journey is associated with a tag and unassociated the tag using the deleteTags resource.

parameters.description: Key of the journey. The Key deletes all versions of the journey, unless a versionNumber is provided

parameters.name: versionNumber
parameters.description: Version number of the journey to delete. If no version is specified, ALL versions associated with the provided ID will be deleted

get.description: Retrieves a list of content assets.

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Determines which asset property to use for sorting, and also determines the direction in which to sort the data. If you don't provide the $orderBy parameter, the results are sorted by asset ID in ascending order

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter by an asset's property using a simple operator and value

parameters.name: $fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited string of asset properties used to reduce the size of your results to only the properties you need

post.description: Creates a new content asset with the specified information.

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

delete.description: Deletes a content asset by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the content asset to delete

parameters.name: isCDNDelete
parameters.description: Permanently deletes the file and its URL in Akamai when the associated file is deleted in Content Builder. A value of 1 permanently deletes the file. If isCDNDelete is unspecified or if the value is 0, it doesnâ€™t permanently delete the file

patch.description: Updates an existing content asset with the specified information.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the content asset to update

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

get.description: Retrieves a list of content categories.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter by ParentId using a simple operator and value. ParentId is the only allowed field. If you don't provide a $filter parameter, the query returns all the Categories in your MID

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Determines which category property to use for sorting, and also determines the direction in which to sort the data. If you don't provide the $orderBy parameter, the results are sorted by category ID in ascending order

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: Determines which MIDs the query results come from. To return categories that reside in your MID, either don't add the scope parameter or call the endpoint like this: .../categories?scope=Ours. To return categories that are shared to your MID, or that you have shared with other MIDs, call the endpoint like this: .../categories?scope=Shared. To return all categories visible to your MID, call the endpoint like this: .../categories?scope=Ours,Shared

post.description: Creates a new content category with the specified information.

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

get.description: Retrieves a list of email definitions.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter by status type. Accepted values are active, inactive, or deleted. Valid operations are eq and neq

parameters.name: $orderBy
parameters.description: Sort by a dimension. You can sort by only one dimension. Accepted values are definitionKey, name, createdDate, modifiedDate, and status

requestBody.description: Payload to be sent with the request

200.description: Bulk ingest request accepted and processed

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the request

requestId.description: The unique identifier of this request

modifiedDate.description: Date and time the definition was most recently changed

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object

description.description: User-provided description of the send definition

classification.description: The external key of a sending classification defined in Email Studio Administration. Only transactional classifications are permitted. Default is default transactional

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isnâ€™t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days

EmailDefinition.description: Represents an email definition in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

contactID.description: Type-value object specifying ContactID tied to given address

addressTypeID.description: Type of the retrieved address: EMAIL: 1 MOBILE: 4 PUSH: 9 LINE: 10

addressKey.description: Type-value object specifying the AddressKey for retrieved address

modifiedDate.description: Last modified date value of retrieved address

contactKey.description: Type-value object specifying ContactKey tied to given address

valueSets.description: Object array containing value set information of pertinent attributes retrieved for address

addressID.description: Type-value object specifying the AddressID for retrieved address

customerKey.description: Reference to customer's private ID/name for the asset

name.description: Name of the asset, set by the client. 200 character maximum

description.description: Description of the asset, set by the client

category.description: ID of the category the asset belongs to

contentType.description: The type that the Content attribute is in

assetType.description: The type of the asset saved as a name/ID pair

UpsertAsset.description: Request body for creating or updating a content asset

count.description: Total number of journeys returned in this page

JourneysList.description: Response containing a collection of journeys

valueID.description: An auto-generated guid representing a retrieved attribute value for the retrieved address

definitionName.description: The value definition name of a retrieved attribute for retrieved address

innerValue.description: Actual value of a retrieved attribute for the retrieved address

definitionKey.description: The value definition key of a retrieved attribute for retrieved address

definitionID.description: The value definition ID of a retrieved attribute for retrieved address

keys.description: A map of key fields for the data extension row. The property names and types are arbitrary and depend on the data extension definition

values.description: A map of value fields for the data extension row. The property names and types are arbitrary and depend on the data extension definition

validators.description: List of validators to apply to the email address

ValidateEmailRequest.description: Request body for validating an email address

id.description: The unique ID for the activity.

key.description: The unique customer key for the activity.

name.description: The display name for this activity.

type.description: Defines the activity type. The expected input for each activity must be passed as an argument to operate correctly.

arguments.description: An object that represents the arguments that the activity expects to be passed at runtime. Each activity type requires a different set of parameters.

configurationArguments.description: An object that represents the arguments that the activity expects to be passed at publish and runtime. Each activity type requires a different set of parameters.

Activity.description: Represents a single activity in a journey

Extras.description:
Extras to include. Values:
- all: Fetch all extras
- activities: Include journey activities
- outcomes: Include journey outcomes
- stats: Include journey statistics
- '': No extras (default)

schema.description: Schema information for an event. The call uses this information to create a data extension associated with the Event Definition. Only required when not providing a dataExtensionId value

eventDefinitionKey.description: Unique customer key for the event definition. Used to reference this event in API calls and journeys

mode.description: Operation mode of the event definition. Can be 'Production' or 'Test'

metaData.description: Optional metadata for the event definition. Can include additional information or settings

sourceApplicationExtensionId.description: A link to the application extension that defines the configuration screens for this type. Journey Builder uses this ID to filter shared entry sources. For example, for the Event Definition to be visible in the Existing Entry sources panel in the UI, this field must be populated. To obtain this value, perform a GET eventDefinition on similar events in Journey Builder

isVisibleInPicker.description: If true, makes this event visible in the Journey Builder Event Picker UI

configuration.description: Optional configuration data for the event definition. Can include additional settings or parameters

name.description: Display name for the event definition. Visible in Journey Builder UI

description.description: Optional description for the event definition, visible in UI

dataExtensionId.description: ID of the Data Extension used as the data source for the event. Optional if 'schema' is provided inline

EventDefinition.description: Represents an event definition in Journey Builder. An event definition is a reusable component that defines how an event is triggered and processed within a journey

hasOptedOutTracking.description: Indicates whether a contact opted out of tracking information

key.description: The unique customer key for the outcome.

next.description: A string that maps to a valid journey activity key.

autoAddSubscriber.description: Adds the recipientâ€™s email address and contact key as a subscriber key to subscriptions.list. Default is true

dataExtension.description: The external key of the triggered send data extension. Each request inserts as a new row in the data extension

updateSubscriber.description: For email only: Updates the recipientâ€™s contact key as a subscriber key with the provided email address and profile attributes to subscriptions.list. Default is true

list.description: The external key of the list or all subscribers. Contains the subscriber keys and profile attributes

EventDefinitionKey.description: Key of the entry event defined in Journey Builder

Data.description: Additional attributes required by the entry event schema

key.description: The customer key for this goal.

name.description: The display name for this goal.

type.description: The type of goal this is (only option currently is ContactEvent).

description.description: The description for this goal, will be displayed in the Journey Builder user interface.

metaData.description: A set of properties which are not specific to the definition or execution of this Event, but are related to it.

conversionUnit.description: This value is used for deterministic evaluations of the goal, can be either 'percentage' or 'wholenumber'.

conversionValue.description: Based on the conversionUnit this is the metric Journey Builder uses to determine if the goal has been satisfied.

Goal.description: Represents a goal in a journey

addresses.description: Array of all address objects retrieved

hasErrors.description: Indicates errors occured while processing the request

serviceMessageID.description: Service message ID value of the response

requestServiceMessageID.description: Service message ID value of the request

resultMessages.description: Array of returned messages generated while processing the request

id.description: Unique identifier for the import operation

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the import request

ImportResponse.description: Response for importing a data extension file asynchronously

serviceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the response

channelAddressResponseEntities.description: List of contact keys with their created date and time

requestServiceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the request

SearchContactsByEmailResponse.description: Response contains a list of contact keys with their created date and time

responseDateTime.description: Date and time of the response

serviceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the response

requestServiceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the request

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the request

customerKey.description: Reference to customer's private ID/name for the asset.

contentType.description: The type that the Content attribute is in.

assetType.description: The type of the asset saved as a name/ID pair.

name.description: Name of the asset, set by the client. 200 character maximum.

description.description: Description of the asset, set by the client.

category.description: ID of the category the asset belongs to.

Asset.description: Represents a content asset in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

ContactAttributeName.description: The name of the contact attribute to search by

contactID.description: Unique ID for the contact. You must provide either a value for contactKey or contactID

contactKey.description: Primary address for the contact. You must provide either a value for contactKey or contactID

attributeSets.description: List of attribute sets for the contact

UpsertContactRequest.description: Request body for creating a new contact

messageKey.description: A unique identifier for the message send attempt

message.description: Error message for this recipient, if any

errorcode.description: Error code for this recipient, if any

startDateUtc.description: The start date in UTC for the query.

endDateUtc.description: The end date in UTC for the query.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page.

requestServiceMessageID.description: ID of the request service message.

ContactDeleteRequestsResponse.description: Response containing details of contact delete requests

contactKey.description: Contact key of the email channel address

Versions.description: List of version numbers of the journey to remove contact from

ContactKey.description: ID that uniquely identifies a subscriber or contact. Can be a single contact or an array of up to 50

DefinitionKey.description: Customer Key that uniquely identifies the journey

responses.description: Array of message send results, one per recipient

errorcode.description: Error code for the overall request, if any

SendEmailMessageResponse.description: Response for sending an email message. Each item in 'responses' corresponds to a recipient and may include error details if the send failed

example.message: MCMS_UTM_ResponsesHasErrors: 1 subscribers failed to queue out of 2

channelAddressList.description: List of email channel addresses for which a contact key is requested

maximumCount.description: Number of contact keys associated with an email channel address. The default value is 1

SearchContactsByEmailRequest.description: Request body for searching contacts by email channel address

createdDate.description: The date and time the campaign was created.

modifiedDate.description: The date and time the campaign was last modified.

id.description: The unique identifier for the campaign.

campaignCode.description: A code used to identify the campaign.

color.description: A color code associated with the campaign.

favorite.description: Indicates if the campaign is marked as a favorite.

Campaign.description: Represents a campaign in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

email.description: An ordered list of email expressions used to determine which email address to use as the default.

Defaults.description: An object that contains default values for the journey, such as email expressions. Example: { "email": ["{{Event.event-key.EmailAddress}}", "{{Contact.Default.Email}}"] }

responseDateTime.description: Date and time of the retry response in UTC

serviceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the response

requestServiceMessageID.description: Service message ID for the request

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the request. Includes details, such as resulttype and resultcode, about a bad request

ContactPreferencesResponse.description: Retrieved contact preferences by contact key

definitionName.description: Default name assigned to represent the Set Definition of value Set information for retrieved address

values.description: Object array containing property definition and actual value information of attributes retrieved for address

definitionKey.description: Default key assigned to represent the Set Definition of value Set information for retrieved address

definitionID.description: Default ID assigned to represent the Set Definition of value Set information for retrieved address

id.description: A unique identifier for this journey (read-only).

version.description: The iteration/version number of the journey (read-only).

key.description: The customer-defined unique key for this journey.

name.description: Display name of the journey in the UI.

description.description: Human-readable explanation of the journey's purpose.

workflowApiVersion.description: Version of the Journey Spec used.

goals.description: An array of goals containing a single object. Journeys only support one goal.

triggers.description: An array of triggers containing a single object. Journeys only support one trigger.

activities.description: An array that includes all the activities of the journey.

jobStatus.description: Job status (New, Staging, Queued, Processing, Complete, Error)

jobExpirationHours.description: Can specify a value up to 8 hours - this value drives the time allocated to stage data before starting a job. Note: For larger staging time (over 8 hours), contact support

CreateBulkIngestJob.description: Definition for a bulk ingest job targeting a data extension

trackLinks.description: Wraps links for tracking and reporting. Default is true

rowsAffected.description: Number of rows affected by the operation.

contactKey.description: The unique key of the contact.

contactID.description: The system-generated ID of the contact.

contactTypeID.description: The type ID of the contact.

isNewContactKey.description: Indicates whether the contact key is newly created.

requestServiceMessageID.description: The ID of the request message.

responseDateTime.description: The date and time of the response.

hasErrors.description: Indicates if any errors occurred during the operation.

serviceMessageID.description: The ID of the service message.

channelAddress.description: Channel address of the email channel

contactKeyDetails.description: Contact key details associated with the channel address

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the import summary

ImportSummaryResponse.description: Response containing the summary of a data extension import operation

recipients.description: Required. An array of recipient objects containing parameters and metadata for the recipients, such as send tracking and personalization attributes. If this object is present in the request, the recipient array (which is used to send messages to a single recipient) can't be included in the request

definitionKey.description: Required. The ID of the send definition

attributes.description: Information used to personalize the message for the request. Written as key-value pairs. The attributes match profile attributes, content attributes, or triggered send data extension attributes

SendEmailMessageRequest.description: Request body for sending an email message using a previously created email definition

categoryType.description: The type of category, either asset or asset-shared.

memberId.description: ID of the member who creates the category.

enterpriseId.description: ID of the enterprise this business unit belongs to.

sharingProperties.description: Stores the MIDs of business units this category is shared with and the sharing type. Only included in the response if CategoryType is asset-shared.

meta.description: Meta is used much like the data attribute on CMS assets but for internal functionality in Content Builder. If meta is returned, be sure to pass it through the API.

Category.description: Represents a content category in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

filterConditionValue.description: Value for attribute used in search criteria for contacts and associated addresses. When using the "LastModifiedDate" attributeName, separate the values for start and end date in the filterConditionValue with an "AND". The "Channel" attributeName supports these values: MOBILE PUSH LINE EMAIL

ContactAttributeFilterCondition.description: Filter condition for searching contacts by attribute

valid.description: Indicates whether the email address is valid

failedValidation.description: The validator that failed, if any

email.description: The email address that was validated

targetId.description: Target object ID for the import

endDate.description: End date and time of the import operation

restrictedRows.description: Number of restricted rows found in the import

targetUpdateType.description: Type of update performed on the target

totalRows.description: Total number of rows processed in the import

targetKey.description: Target object key for the import

importId.description: Unique identifier for the import operation

duplicateRows.description: Number of duplicate rows found in the import

id.description: Unique identifier for the import summary

errors.description: Number of errors encountered during the import

startDate.description: Start date and time of the import operation

campaignCode.description: A code used to identify the campaign.

color.description: A color code associated with the campaign.

favorite.description: Indicates if the campaign is marked as a favorite.

UpsertCampaign.description: Represents a campaign in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

customerKey.description: Unique identifier of the content asset

messageKey.description: A unique identifier that you can use to track the status of the message. If not provided, the system generates one. Must be unique among all of the keys used in your business unit over the prior 72 hours. Max 100 characters

contactKey.description: Required. A unique identifier for the subscriber. You can create a contact key at send time if the contact isnâ€™t already in Marketing Cloud Engagement

attributes.description: Personalization information for the recipient. Written as key-value pairs. The attributes match profile attributes, content attributes, or triggered send data extension attributes

eventInstanceId.description: Unique ID for the fired event instance

ContactKeyList.description: The list of unique keys that identify the contacts

id.description: Journey UUID (optional if key is provided)

modifiedDate.description: Current modifiedDate, required to prevent concurrent writes

goals.description: Goals that define journey completion or exit criteria

activities.description: Activities that define the steps in the journey

UpdateJourney.description: Request body for updating an existing journey

JourneyStatus.description: A journey status value to use to filter the results. The ScheduledToSend, Sent, and Stopped statuses exist only in single-send journeys. If you don't specify a status value, the API returns all journeys regardless of their statuses

name.description: Name of the definition. Must be unique

definitionKey.description: Unique, user-generated key to access the definition object

description.description: User-provided description of the send definition

classification.description: The external key of a sending classification defined in Email Studio Administration. Only transactional classifications are permitted. Default is default transactional

status.description: Operational state of the definition: active, inactive, or deleted. A message sent to an active definition is processed and delivered. A message sent to an inactive definition isnâ€™t processed or delivered. Instead, the message is queued for later processing for up to three days

CreateEmailDefinition.description: Request body for creating a new email definition

AssetList.description: Response containing a collection of content assets

values.description: List of name/value pairs for the attributes

AttributeSetItem.description: Represents an item in an attribute set, containing multiple attributes

message.example: No change has been processed, supplied data matches that on the server.

NoChangeResponse.description: Response indicating no changes were made

items.description: Array of contact IDs and other properties to add

AttributeSetValue.description: Represents a name/value pair for an attribute

specifier.description: Name of the source file (compressed or uncompressed). In case of multiple files, specify the folder name

allowErrors.description: Indicates if the import should continue past row level errors. Defaults to true

standardQuotedStrings.description: Indicates if the import respects double quotes (") as a text delimiter

hasMultipleFiles.description: Indicates if the specifier has more than one file to import. Defaults to false

controlColumnDefaultAction.description: Default action against a row if no explicit action code is specified

type.description: The type of the object being imported into. The only supported value is DataExtension

contentType.description: Indicates how the content is delimited

controlColumn.description: Column name in the source file that controls row-level action. For example, add, delete, update and so on

key.description: The unique (customerKey) reference of the data extension

updateType.description: The type of import operation to perform against the destination data extension

fieldMappingType.description: Indicates the type of field mapping

transportKey.description: The external key of an active file transfer location

ImportRequest.description: Request body for importing a data extension file. Inherits properties from fileInfo, target, mapping, and transport

createdDate.description: Creation date of the email definition

modifiedDate.description: Last modification date of the email definition

definitionKey.description: Unique key for the email definition

DataExtensionRowSet.description: An array of data extension rows to be upserted

definitionInstanceId.description: The unique identifier for the journey instance from which the contact was removed

message.description: A message providing additional information about the exit operation

version.description: The version of the journey from which the contact was removed

CategoryList.description: Response containing a collection of content categories

requestId.description: Request ID for tracking the operation

bulkApiDefinitionId.description: Unique identifier for the bulk API definition

resultMessages.description: Array of messages about the bulk ingest job

CreateBulkIngestJobResponse.description: Response for creating a bulk ingest job targeting a data extension

name.description: Name of the attribute set (e.g., 'Email Addresses', 'Email Demographics')

items.description: List of items for the attribute set

AttributeSet.description: Represents a set of attributes for a contact

StartDateTime.description: The first time the scheduled automation should run.

EndDateTime.description: The last time the scheduled automation should run. Required if EndType = EndDate.

Occurrences.description: How many times the scheduled automation should run. Required if EndType = Occurrences.

EndType.description: EndDate or Occurrences, indicates if automation schedule should stop after a specified date or a specified number of runs.

Frequency.description: Minutely, Hourly, Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Yearly

RecurrencePattern.description: Interval - used by Minutely, Hourly, Daily; EveryWeekDay - used by Daily; ByDay - used by Weekly, Monthly, Yearly; ByWeek - used by Monthly, Yearly

Interval.description: Used for Minutely, Hourly, Daily, Weekly, and Monthly schedules (not used for Yearly). Required if RecurrencePattern = Interval.

Sunday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Monday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Tuesday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Wednesday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Thursday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Friday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

Saturday.description: Only used for weekly schedules. May be null.

ScheduledDay.description: Day of month (1 to 31), used for Monthly and Yearly schedules.

ScheduledDayOfWeek.description: Name of day of week (Sunday), used for Monthly and Yearly schedules.

ScheduledWeek.description: First, Second, Third, Fourth, Last, used for Monthly and Yearly schedules.

EventDefinitionSchedule.description: Optionally define a schedule for the event. Used to trigger the event on a recurring basis

items.description: Array of contact keys or IDs to search for preferences

operationInitiated.description: Indicates if the operation was initiated successfully

operationID.description: Unique identifier for the initiated operation

responseDateTime.description: Date and time of the response

hasErrors.description: Indicates if there were any errors during the operation

resultMessages.description: List of result messages from the operation

cc.description: Include CC email addresses with every send. To CC dynamically at send time, create a profile attribute and use the %%attribute%% syntax

bcc.description: Include BCC email addresses with every send. To BCC dynamically at send time, create a profile attribute and use the %%attribute%% syntax

trackLinks.description: Wraps links for tracking and reporting. Default is true

createJourney.description: A value of true updates the send definition to make it available in Journey Builder as a Transactional Send Journey. After the definition is tied to a Transactional Send Journey, the definition remains part of Journey Builder. You canâ€™t unlink a journey from a definition without recreating the transactional send definition

categoryType.description: The type of category, either asset or asset-shared.

memberId.description: ID of the member who creates the category.

enterpriseId.description: ID of the enterprise this business unit belongs to.

sharingProperties.description: Stores the MIDs of business units this category is shared with and the sharing type. Only included in the response if CategoryType is asset-shared.

CreateCategory.description: Represents a content category in Salesforce Marketing Cloud

values.description: List of contact keys or IDs to delete

DeleteOperationType.description: Type of delete operation to perform

page.name: $page
page.description: The page number of results to retrieve. The default value is 1

pageSize.name: $pageSize
pageSize.description: The number of items to return on a page of results. The default and maximum value is 50

extras.name: extras
extras.description: Additional information to include in the response. When you specify the all value for this parameter, the response includes a large amount of data. The volume of this data has a negative impact on the performance of this query
